Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of SGM-101 for Intraoperative Fluorescence Imaging in Colorectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: This ascending dose, exploratory study was conducted in the Netherlands, involving 37 patients

Participants.evidence: involving 37 patients with primary or recurrent CRC

Intervention.evidence: Patients received a single dose of SGM-101 (5 mg, 7.5 mg, 10 mg, 12.5 mg, or 15 mg) intravenously

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the optimal imaging dose of SGM-101 for intraoperative fluorescence imaging of primary and recurrent CRC.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Safety assessments and efficacy evaluations were performed per dose level.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From January 2016 to January 2019, 37 patients were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The highest mean intraoperative tumor-to-background ratio (TBR) of 1.9 (p = 0.019) was observed at the 10 mg dose

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study is registered under ClinicalTrials.gov identifier NCT02973672

Funding.evidence: was funded by the Centre for Human Drug Research
